clone_system.description: When your capsule is destroyed, your clone is activated. Clone grade determines how many skill points are retained. Wise players keep clones updated to avoid losing training time.

alpha_clone.name: Alpha Clone
alpha_clone.description: Basic clone provided free of charge. Limited skill point retention.

beta_clone.name: Beta Clone
beta_clone.description: Improved clone with moderate skill point retention.

gamma_clone.name: Gamma Clone
gamma_clone.description: Advanced clone with good skill point retention.

delta_clone.name: Delta Clone
delta_clone.description: High-grade clone with excellent skill point retention.

epsilon_clone.name: Epsilon Clone
epsilon_clone.description: Top-grade clone with near-perfect skill point retention.

omega_clone.name: Omega Clone
omega_clone.description: Ultimate clone with maximum skill point retention.

jump_clones.description: Jump clones allow instant travel to a pre-placed clone body. Requires the Infomorph Psychology skill.

death_mechanics.ship_destruction: When your ship is destroyed, you eject in a capsule (pod). The pod can warp to safety.
death_mechanics.pod_kill: If your capsule is destroyed, your clone is activated at the station where your medical clone is located.
death_mechanics.skill_point_loss: If your clone grade cannot cover your total skill points, you lose a percentage of the excess skill points from random skills.
death_mechanics.implant_loss: All implants are destroyed when your capsule is destroyed. Implants are not covered by insurance.
death_mechanics.free_ship: If your clone is activated and you have no ships stored, a basic starter frigate is provided free of charge.
